content: cozy up in this modern take on a classic cable sweater a relaxed drop shoulder silhouette paired with intricate cables and texture create a sweater that is comfortable and timeless this sweater is worked in the round from the bottom up you will separate to work the front and back pieces and join again at the shoulders using a three needle bind off the sleeves and neckband will be worked by picking up stitches and knitting in the round portions of this sweater are worked using cable stitch charts some experience working cable charts is helpful a free version of this pattern can be viewed on my blog 1 this sweater is designed in 9 sizes xs s m l xl 2x 3x 4x 5x finished bust/chest circumference 37 42 46 5 51 55 58 62 5 67 71 finished length 22 22 22 22 22 24 24 24 24 this sweater is designed to be worn with 8-10 of positive ease model is 6 tall has a 33 bust and is wearing a size small with 9 of positive ease for best fit choose a size that is closest to 8-10 larger than your corresponding bust measurement for example if you bust is 50 you would wear a size 2x materials not included 4 5 5 6 6 6 7 7 7 skeins / 808 1010 1010 1212 1212 1212 1414 1414 1414 yds lion brand re-tweed yarn shown in peanut butter size us 9 5 5 mm 32 or longer circular knitting needles or size needed to obtain gauge size us 7 4 5 mm 32 or longer circular knitting needles to work bottom hem size us 7 4 5 mm double pointed needles or circular knitting needle to work sleeve cuffs and neckband cable needle stitch markers stitch holder or scrap yarn tapestry needle to weave in ends gauge 15 stitches and 22 row = 4 in moss stitch on size 9 needles moss stitch is a variation of seed stitch and is worked as follows row 1 and 2 *k1 p1 repeat from * across row 3 and 4 *p1 k1 repeat from * across this is an intermediate + level knitting pattern for this pattern you will need to know how to knit purl work cable stitches be familiar with different increases and decreases pick up stitches and understand sweater construction cable portions are written using cable charts so expirience reading knitting charts is helpful this pattern is written in us english terms this pattern and
